alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 05 at 4:45PM CDT until July 05 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN CHEROKEE...WOODBURY...SOUTHERN SIOUX...PLYMOUTH... DAKOTA...DIXON...SOUTHEASTERN CLAY AND UNION COUNTIES... At 445 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Marcus to near Lawton to near Emerson, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. At 428 PM CDT, a 64 mph gust was reported at Sioux Gateway Airport. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Moville, Kingsley, Marcus and Lawton around 450 PM CDT. Salix around 455 PM CDT. Sloan and Pierson around 500 PM CDT. Correctionville, Anthon and Hornick around 505 PM CDT. Smithland around 515 PM CDT. Cushing around 520 PM CDT. Danbury around 525 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Bronson, Oyens, Brunsville, Waterbury, Oto, Chatsworth and Westfield. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
